alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Phelps; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 20 at 2:35PM CDT until April 20 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Near-Critical to Critical Fire Weather Conditions Likely This Afternoon... ...Potentially Critical Fire Weather Conditions Return Friday... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 039, 046, 060, 061, 072, 073, 082 AND 083... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 039, 046, 060, 061, 072, 073, 082 AND 083... The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * WINDS...Northwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph this afternoon. Southeast 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph Friday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...as low as 15 percent to near 20 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly and exhibit extreme fire behavior. Use extreme caution if engaging in activities that could result in fire ignition.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
